intro: Rolandra diacantha, commonly known as the spiny rock fig, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky outcrops. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
